required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Treatment and Outcomes in Critically Ill Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Treatment and Outcomes in Critically Ill Patients With COVID-19

collaborator.agency: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Weill Medical College of Cornell University
Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School
University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
University Medical Center of Southern Nevada
University of Tennessee Health Science Center
University of Texas, Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter observational/registry study of the clinical features and outcomes of critically ill patients with COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: The goals of this project are to determine the independent risk factors for hospital mortality and acute organ injury, and to identify treatment strategies associated with improved survival. Additionally, we will assess outcomes according to differences in geographic and institutional parameters.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28-days from the day of ICU admission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60-days from the day of ICU admission
90-days from the day of ICU admission

study_pop.textblock: Critically ill adults admitted to an intensive care unit for illness related to COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (each of the following):
1. Adults (aged ≥18 years)
2. Laboratory-confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19
3. Hospitalized in the ICU for illness related to COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
-None
